content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the taurage district court the defendant had to pay a total of €56676 in fees the court made a final decision regarding the division of matrimonial property in a divorce case the movable property including a vehicle was awarded to the defendant while the immovable property an apartment was awarded to the applicant the text discusses three articles from the civil code related to matrimonial property the applicant filed a lawsuit seeking the dissolution of their marriage on the grounds of fault they also requested to retain their family name establish a surname for their son and grant unrestricted access to the son for the defendant the court allowed the action to proceed and addressed the division of matrimonial property the court also ordered the defendant to pay the costs of the legal proceedings and stamp duty the grant application for the dissolution of the marriage was approved the parties agreed on the place of residence for their child with the applicant having custody the defendant was ordered to pay the costs of stateguaranteed legal aid and stamp duty
